summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July 3, 2020, regarding a potential witness who proactively contacted the FBI via LinkedIn. The witness, a woman, claims to have information related to a rape she experienced 20 years prior, which she believes may be connected to the Epstein investigation. The FBI's New York Field Office coordinates to have the appropriate task force agents follow up with her.

persons.name: Ms.
persons.context: A woman who reached out to the FBI via LinkedIn, stating she has information potentially helpful to the Epstein investigation due to a rape she experienced 20 years ago. She requests a Zoom interview for security and prefers an experienced agent.

persons.name: Assistant Director in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Director in Charge, New York Field Office
persons.context: The FBI official who initially responded to the witness's LinkedIn message, explaining that the Epstein investigation task force will contact her and noting security protocols.

persons.name: Special Agent-in-Charge
persons.context: The supervisor whose team is handling the Epstein investigation; copied on the email to coordinate the witness contact.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI New York
persons.context: An FBI supervisor in New York who is coordinating the response to the witness's outreach.

connections.description: The witness initiated contact with the Assistant Director in Charge via LinkedIn, leading to the FBI's internal coordination for an interview.
The Special Agent-in-Charge's team is assigned to handle the Epstein investigation and will be responsible for contacting and interviewing the witness.

events.title: Witness Outreach to FBI
events.description: A woman contacts the FBI's New York Field Office via LinkedIn, offering information related to a past rape that may connect to the Epstein investigation. The FBI internally coordinates a response and plans to have the Epstein task force agents contact her.

events.title: Alleged Rape of Witness
events.description: The witness references being raped 20 years prior (circa 2000) and indicates she tried to seek justice at that time but the climate was not conducive. She is now reaching out to the FBI in connection with the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: A potential witness contacted the FBI's New York Field Office on July 3, 2020, via LinkedIn, claiming to have information related to a rape from 20 years ago that may connect to the Epstein investigation.
The witness expressed a preference for a Zoom interview over a phone call for security reasons, citing a recent bad online experience and living under provable online threat for over 20 years.

The FBI's Assistant Director in Charge responded, explaining that the Epstein investigation task force, led by a Special Agent-in-Charge, would handle the contact, initially likely via phone due to security protocols around Zoom.
The witness mentioned she was waiting for Scotland Yard to find notes from over 20 years ago to help her seek justice and recompense.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination to ensure the witness is contacted by the appropriate investigative team handling the Epstein case.
